p: NO production may reflect inflammation; the effect of CS-LO on LPS-induced NO in RAW 264.7 cells was assessed. After treatment with CS-LO and L-NAME (NO inhibitor), the level of NO in RAW 264.7 was evaluated. As shown in Figures 2(a) and 2(b), there was a concentration-dependent inhibition in NO production. The group treated with 10 μg/L CS-LO (p < 0.01) was highly decreased compared to the LPS-alone group, and L-NAME (100 µM) also have a significant inhibition on the NO in RAW 264.7 cells ( Figure 2(a)). Moreover, the image of confocal laser scanning microscopy indicates that the NO production was also suppressed by CS-LO ( Figure 2(b)).
